intro: Haemocharis portoricensis, commonly known as the Puerto Rican torch ginger, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean island of Puerto Rico. It belongs to the ginger family, Zingiberaceae, and is characterized by its vibrant red and orange inflorescences. The plant features narrow, strap-like leaves and produces fragrant, showy flowers that bloom throughout the warmer months. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in shaded, moist environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
